intro: Odontarrhena muralis, commonly known as the wall barley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in rocky or wall environments. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Odontarrhena muralis is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and can tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
